tweet: Rest In Peace, John Singleton — an amazing film director. Boyz N The Hood is an American classic that deserves a places on the “best” lists of American cinema.

Just one day after Poway, another life has been lost to gun violence & many more shot at. My heart goes out to the victims of these senseless acts. But sending sympathies will not prevent another tragedy. The grief we feel needs to amount to real, legislative change. #Baltimore
All things considered, the @Spurs finished the season strong. It’s weird to see them out of the playoffs so early, but next year should be much better. #GoSpursGo
How many more innocent people need to die before this country rises up and finally protects its own?

The time for thoughts and prayers has passed. Today’s violent attack at Chabad of Poway appears to be a brutal hate crime. Anti-semitism continues to rear its ugly head right here at home. These victims fall prey to gun violence for just exercising their right to worship.

The oversight committees in the Texas legislature should investigate whether @GregAbbott_TX directed or coordinated with the Texas Secretary of State to illegally purge Texans from the voter rolls. #txlege

"The right to vote is a fundamental part of American democracy. The state has been forced to withdraw its discriminatory voter purge, but Texans will not forget this assault on our democratic process." My full statement on Texas ending voter purge efforts: https://bit.ly/2XNHe18
The CEO of Eli Lilly has agreed to come before the @HispanicCaucus on May 9 to discuss skyrocketing insulin prices.
There are three companies that control the global insulin market — Eli Lilly, Novo Nordisk and Sanofi. The @HispanicCaucus will meet with the CEO of @sanofi on May 8. #diabetes
The spike in insulin affects all Americans with diabetes — not just the Latino community. We will speak up for everyone.

Diabetes is rampant in the Hispanic community. My grandmother died of complications from diabetes. My mom is diabetic. I will let you know which insulin manufacturers’ CEOs agree to meet and which do not. #diabetes

As Chair of the @HispanicCaucus I am setting up meetings for us with 3 major insulin manufacturers because the price of insulin has skyrocketed 300% in the past decade. Please let us know your story or a relative’s story and what this price hike has meant for you. #diabetes
Please call my office at 210-348-8216 and I’ll be glad to try to help. Toni Serna is my district director.

The Trump Admin is intentionally including a citizenship Q in the #2020Census to undercount Latinos and immigrants. As #SCOTUS hears opening arguments today, we need to remember these immigrants who are cast aside & fearful to participate in our democracy. https://www.npr.org/2019/04/23/705210786/a-decade-of-implications-at-stake-supreme-court-hears-census-citizenship-questio …

The @HispanicCaucus will take an assertive role in addressing high insulin prices. The cost of insulin has tripled over the past 10 years! https://twitter.com/HispanicCaucus/status/1120475624144084992 …

“As we mark this Earth Day, I am hopeful for a better future for our children. While the Trump Administration has abdicated our global leadership on climate issues, local leaders are doing their part to fight climate change.” Full statement ⬇️  https://bit.ly/2UQVZ6o

Last week, I met with Map Pesqueira, a UT ROTC student who recently lost his scholarship due @realDonaldTrump’s transgender military ban. This bigoted ban runs counter to our American values. I support Map & all dedicated students like him. pic.twitter.com/PjqYCqjkj3
I hope everyone celebrating Easter has had a great day with family and friends!

The brutal & senseless attacks in Sri Lanka have brought grief to a day founded on joy. My prayers are with those who lost their loved ones today. To all those celebrating Easter - we must recommit, on today of all days, to stamp out the scourge of hate across the world.
Joining @CNN @wolfblitzer at 5 PM CT/6 PM ET to discuss the #MuellerReport and next steps.

“Attorney General Barr has been doing a real public relations campaign for the President for a few weeks now & really trying to soften the blow. The DOJ briefed the WH on the #MuellerReport before the American public has seen it. AG Barr now refuses to release the report until after his press conference. 

Enough is enough. This is not a PR campaign. Americans deserve the chance to make a judgment call for themselves.

Sure, but inertia leads to less tips. https://twitter.com/freewimin/status/1115767591128182791 …

I hope hotels will step up voluntarily but there’s probably room for legislation that would require electronic tipping methods  for businesses that maintain tipped employees on staff. I’m going to look into it.

I agree that wages should be raised. In the meantime, hotels are hurting their housekeepers/valets by not accepting tips electronically. Unlike waiters/waitresses, there’s no way to leave a tip if you don’t have cash on you. This is a big deal for lots of ppl. @AFLCIO @SEIU

Agree. Also, hotels should help their workers by adopting an electronic system for tipping. Lots of hotel guests no longer carry cash yet most hotels provide no easy way to tip electronically. @Marriott @Hyatt @HiltonHotels @IHGCorporate https://twitter.com/chrislhayes/status/1115725327106547713 …

The threat of losing #ACA protections is great in Texas, where we have the highest uninsured rate in the country. Americans don’t want to go back to the old system of high out-of-pocket costs. I won’t leave my constituents who rely on the #ACA out to dry. #ProtectOurCare

We must support and foster all of our kid’s growing bodies and minds with quality facilities that give them the space to flourish. #NationalHealthySchoolsDay https://twitter.com/ChildrensE/status/1113086564786147335 …

Our country & the economy are strengthened when women are empowered & supported. All of us should be able to secure economic justice for our families. Women deserve that same value and respect under the law and on their paychecks. #EqualPayDay https://bit.ly/2OGAX42

American workers cross the border to work at American companies in Mexico. Families who live on either side of the border cross to visit relatives. Closing the border would do nothing to solve the humanitarian situation at the border long-terms. It would likely make things worse.

Closing down our border crossings would devastate Texas more than any other state. Millions of dollars in trade pass through the U.S.- Mexico border each day, and billions every year. Many U.S. companies rely on the ability to send and receive goods to and from Mexico.
